page.title: 09MAN AND THE LANDSCAPE
page.content: The relief in this area is mainly very flat, level land with a few {drumlins}giving some hilly areas e.g. Bellahouston Park, whose natural looking state of rich grassy hills and abundant trees encompassing the smooth dome_shaped top contrast sharply with the straightness of the motorway. The oldest{man-made {landscape}is the mixed tenement and industrial areas of Govan and Ibrox. Cardonald and Mosspark have a suburban appearance with semi_detached and four in a block houses with gardens. Near the Clyde the land is very flat and modern housing has replaced some of the docks and shipyards. Princes Dock is being filled in at present and is to be used for a garden festival in 1988 and then housing.
